articles.title: Appendix cancer cases on the rise in youngsters: 5 early signs that go unnoticed - Times of India
articles.description: Appendix cancer has long been considered one of the rarest cancers, affecting just 1 to 2 people per million each year, according to the National Cancer Institute. But recent findings have drawn attention to an unexpected shift: cases are rising significantly…
articles.content: Diet change, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), or stress-related issues. Appendix tumors can cause subtle shifts in bowel movements, including unexplained constipation, diarrhea, or irregular patterns.… [+166 chars]
